image.altText: Matt Wright has brown hair and is wearing a button-up shirt as he walks towards the court.

props.synopsis: Australia's aviation regulator has launched a counter-claim against Matt Wright, arguing the TV star should pay any damages awarded to the widow of the man killed in a 2022 chopper crash.

title.children: Cross-claim launched against Matt Wright over fatal chopper crash

image.altText: Communications equipment inside the Pine Gap base, seen from afar at night.

props.synopsis: Aia Newport is calling for an audit into the council's ties to Israel and a ban on Pine Gap, the US military and its official representatives from community events.

title.children: Greens council hopefuls bid to ban Pine Gap from Alice Springs events

image.altText: A white woman, purple bob hair cut, white blazer, black top sitting in chair in NT parliament.

props.synopsis: Late last month, the NT government provided its long-awaited formal response to a landmark domestic violence inquiry, stating most of the recommendations are already in place. But is that the case?

title.children: Has the NT government made any progress on a landmark DV inquiry?

image.altText: Red, purple, yellow and blue signs sit about four blue skip bins.

props.synopsis: Recycling is important to reduce materials that go into landfill, but how can you do it in Alice Springs?

title.children: With no kerbside recycling in Alice Springs, how do you recycle?

image.altText: Santos sign

props.synopsis: The battle for control of oil and gas giant Santos moved up a gear this week after Ryan Stokes, chairman of Beach Energy and son of billionaire Kerry, took a swipe at the Abu Dhabi government's tilt for a large slice of Australia's energy market.

title.children: Disturbing history behind company in Santos takeover bid

image.altText: The brick exterior of the Alice Springs Town Council is seen on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: With the Alice Springs council election less than a week away, seven candidates for mayor have come forward to share their vision for Alice Springs.

title.children: Who are the candidates to be the next Alice Springs mayor, and what do they stand for?

image.altText: A man sits on a pile of tyres.

props.synopsis: Two Darwin businesses have been left with tonnes of tyres and a massive clean-up bill after falling victim to a tyre dumping scheme that has impacted people across Australia.

title.children: The 'nightmare' scam that illegally dumped 50 tonnes of old tyres in a yard

image.altText: Ethan Guo sits in the cockpit of a plane.

props.synopsis: The American pilot must leave Chile's Antarctic territory as soon as possible. But he can't use his plane to do so.

title.children: Chile wants teen pilot and influencer out of Antarctica but he says he's 'stuck' there

image.altText: Homelessness epidemic

props.synopsis: A military court has found a New Zealand soldier guilty of attempted espionage for a foreign power — the first spying conviction in the country's history.

title.children: Military court finds New Zealand soldier guilty of attempted espionage

image.altText: Putin smiles as he shakes Trump's hand, while Trump looks a little sheepish.

props.synopsis: Beyond the optics, Donald Trump handed Vladimir Putin a number of other wins that will shore up his support at home and reinforce to the world that US-Russia relations have been normalised.

title.children: Putin got the red-carpet treatment from Trump. Where does this leave Ukraine?

image.altText: Surfer in black wetsuit holds up board with large shark bite.

props.synopsis: A surfer sitting on his board was attacked early this morning on the New South Wales north coast.

title.children: Surfer's 'miracle' escape as shark snaps board in two at NSW beach

image.altText: Anthony Albanese in parliament points his hand at the Opposition Leader.

props.synopsis: Delulu's addition — derived from the word delusional — cites an example used by the prime minister in the lead up to the election.

title.children: Anthony Albanese gets a shout out as 'delulu' enters the Cambridge Dictionary

image.altText: Two Australian $100 bills, the top being genuine and the bottom a counterfeit that reads "copy" in the top right corner.

props.synopsis: Genuine Australian bank notes have security features like hidden images and fluorescent ink, and return to shape after being scrunched.

title.children: Counterfeit cash is circulating. Here's how to spot a fake note

image.altText: A view of a National Australia Bank logo in Sydney

props.synopsis: The bank's payroll review and remediation is ongoing, and total costs remain uncertain, according to NAB's latest ASX release.

title.children: NAB flags $130 million hit after underpaying staff, as payroll problems widen

image.altText: Dr Vahid Reza Adib

props.synopsis: Rosemarie Campbell died in 2022 after a gastric bypass surgery performed by Dr Reza Adib, the partner of former Queensland premier Annastacia Palaszczuk.

title.children: Former premier's partner questioned over patient's death after surgery

image.altText: a woman sitting in front of a computer desk

props.synopsis: Working from home may become the presumed status of Australia's white-collar workforce as part of a new push from the Australian Services Union.

title.children: The ASU is pushing for presumed work from home. Here's what that means

props.synopsis: Moana Hope details the "vile and disgusting" verbal abuse she was on the receiving end of at a local football game over the weekend.

title.children: Former AFLW star details 'vile and disgusting' abuse at local footy game

image.altText: A woman shirtless standing near a fence with bras with her arms wide open and a smile on her face

props.synopsis: The mental toll of being left with one breast after cancer surgery weighed heavily on Joanna Atzori until she stumbled across another option.

title.children: 'I think I like this'. Why Joanna chose to go flat after breast cancer

image.altText: Vector illustration featuring robotic arms above two human figures working at conveyor belt lined with boxes.

props.synopsis: Experts share 23 bold, surprising and thought-provoking ideas to boost Australia's productivity growth — and improve living standards.

title.children: Boosting Australia's struggling productivity needs bold ideas. Here are 23 of them

image.altText: A Queensland police badge on a sleeve.

props.synopsis: Police say emergency services were called to a residence on Sunday where a 55-year-old woman was found with a stab wound to her chest.

title.children: 12yo girl charged with attempted murder over alleged stabbing

image.altText: A group of people stading outside.

props.synopsis: Labor and Dean Winter's bid for Tasmania's government appears to have failed, with the Greens and key independents announcing they will not support Labor's foreshadowed no-confidence motion.

title.children: Tasmanian Labor's bid for minority government set to fail

image.altText: Passengers line up for security screening at the airport.

props.synopsis: International travel has been in the spotlight recently, with nerve-wracking tales of border crackdowns in the US and unexpected detentions. Here's what your passport reveals about you when you're travelling.

title.children: Think your passport is just ID? Here's what border officials really know about you

image.altText: A close-up shot of Louise Catherine Carruthers wearing sunglasses and a black and white jacked with her head bowed outside.

props.synopsis: Former WA Corruption and Crime Commission officer Louise Carruthers is set to plead guilty to a charge relating to an alleged relationship with a prison informant.

title.children: Secret relationship with prison informant set to result in guilty plea for ex-CCC employee

image.altText: A photo of Anfas Azad inspecting precious stones. He is wearing a checkered shirt. He has black hair, a close-shaved beard.

props.synopsis: It comes as dozens of Facebook and Instagram users have contacted the ABC about what they say are wrongful account suspensions that have impacted their livelihoods and personal lives.

title.children: Government working toward helping banned Meta users raise complaints

image.altText: A police officer walks across the road.

props.synopsis: A shooting that left one man dead and another seriously injured in Sydney's inner-city has been described by police as a "brazen and callous attack" and a targeted ambush.

title.children: Organised crime links suspected in Sydney inner-city pub shooting

image.altText: Western United player Riku Danzaki controls the ball while a teammate looks on

props.synopsis: Western United has less than three days to save its club after being granted an extension to appeal the decision to strip its A-Leagues licence.

title.children: Western United given extension to appeal stripping of A-Leagues licence

image.altText: A map showing the Earth's tectonic plates.

props.synopsis: With Australia's most significant earthquake disaster occurring more than 35 years ago, many people consider quakes to be quite rare in Australia. But it turns out they're more common than you'd think.

title.children: How common are earthquakes in Australia?

image.altText: Putin stands at the door of his plane

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's Secretary of State Marco Rubio and his special envoy Steve Witkoff have spoken about the Alaska summit, discussing "the crux of the deal" they want made between Russia and Ukraine.

title.children: When Putin's jet refuelled in Alaska, the Russians offered to pay in cash

image.altText: A crowd of people holding israeli flags and yellow flags

props.synopsis: Thousands of Israelis rally in Tel Aviv, Jerusalem and other cities, calling for a ceasefire and a hostage deal to be reached.

title.children: Israelis stage nationwide protests to demand end to Gaza war and release of hostages

image.altText: A render of a house.

props.synopsis: The details of property developer Amir Abu Abara's lengthy court case can only now be revealed — five years after he illegally cleared land at Barden Ridge in Sydney's south.

title.children: 'Damage is done': Trees illegally cut down to build luxury mansion

image.altText: steelworks site with gas pipe flame flare

props.synopsis: Skyrocketing electricity and gas prices are pushing domestic manufacturing to a tipping point, BlueScope warns, as its full-year profit drops 90 per cent.

title.children: Soaring energy costs threaten Future Made In Australia, steel boss warns

image.altText: Story Bridge North

props.synopsis: The Queensland Police Service (QPS) says it will take pro-Palestinian protest organisers to court in an effort stop a march over Brisbane's Story Bridge this Sunday.

title.children: Police to take court action over proposed Story Bridge march

image.altText: A butterfly on a flower

props.synopsis: Residents of a WA town hope a balance can be struck so they can keep an "abundance" of monarch butterflies but not the invasive weeds that attract them.

title.children: 'Beautiful' butterfly swarms lured to small town by invasive weeds

image.altText: Brayden Maynard grapples with Izak Rankine

props.synopsis: Collingwood vice-captain Brayden Maynard says homophobic slurs have "happened too often" as the league investigates an alleged remark made by Izak Rankine against the Magpies.

title.children: Pies star says AFL must 'stamp out' homophobic slurs amid Rankine probe

image.altText: A silver-haired man wearing aviator shades smiles broadly

props.synopsis: A Missouri care home announces the death of Hollywood stuntman Ronnie Rondell, who featured on the cover of Pink Floyd's 1975 album Wish You Were Here.

title.children: Hollywood stuntman best known for his Pink Floyd album cover has died aged 88
